page.title: 13TRAFFIC SURVEY ON THE A650
page.content: On July 3rd we spent an hour in the afternoon on a survey of the traffic outside our school, Tong Upper at Westgate Hill, three miles from the centre of Bradford. The road is the A650 which links Bradford and Wakefield and is also an approach road for the M62 and M1 motorways. We divided the vehicles into two groups, long distance traffic and local traffic. The long distance were mainly lorries carryiny a variety of goods such as steel, cement, wool, petrol, chemicals and frozen foods. We noticed lorries belonging to firms from Manchester, London, Scotland and Germany. Some of the lorries belonged to local road haulage firms such as Wilson and Haigh and were taking goods all over the E.E.C. Short distance vehicles carried bread and fresh food or were service vans such as the YEB.
